# Chargement et préparation des données

```{r}
d = read.csv(file = "lafon.csv", sep=",", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)
# set empty fields to 0
d[is.na(d)] = 0
# Text names
colnames(d)
# find the LiSaint
idx = grep("LiSaint", colnames(d), ignore.case = TRUE)
colnames(d)[idx]
```

# Calcul de spécificités

```{r}
# let's see if it's not to heavy to compute (short answer: it isn't indeed)
specs = textometry::specificities(d)
# and now, get it out
# for all
write.csv(specs, file = "specificites.csv")
# just for the desired texts
write.csv(specs[,idx], file = "specificites_lisaints.csv")
```

And out of curiosity, the more specific of:
```{r}
head(sort(specs[, 30], decreasing = TRUE))
head(sort(specs[, 30]))
```
